title: Reading between the lines: the inside story of a daily newspaper
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Mass media - Study and teaching

description: Uses a day at the "Melbourne Age" to show how a daily paper is assembled, and its role in competition with TV and radio. In particular, looks at the news gathering process, the roles of reporting, editorial and production staff, the editorial process, reasons for positioning articles, the use of photographs and graphics, the production process, and the role of advertising. No other credits available.
